dialogue: And you won't tell me where you've been for the past decade?
I'll tell you everything. I just -- I need to ask you something first.
Does your mom know you're alive?
I need to ask you something first.
Okay.
What do you need to ask me?
Do you remember a TV show we used to watch together?
It was called... 'The Pink Opaque.'
Of course I remember The Pink Opaque, Maddy. It's my favorite TV show of all time.
Always will be.
I've got the complete series on DVD. They've got a ride dedicated to it now at One Universe Studios. I'm saving up to go out there...
That's all you wanted to ask me? If I remembered The Pink Opaque?
No, I...
I guess what I mean is... When you think back on watching The Pink Opaque... how do you remember it?
How do I remember it?
Yeah...
Do you remember it as just a TV show?
Yeah... I remember it as a TV show, Maddy.
The Pink Opaque was a TV show...
We watched it in your basement on Saturday nights. From 10:30 to 11pm. Remember? The last show before the young adult network switched to black-and-white reruns for the night.
Yeah, but... Are you sure? Are you sure that's all it was?
Is this some sort of joke? Because
--No. It's not a joke. Listen: I know this might sound crazy, but...
When you think back on The Pink Opaque. When you remember watching it in my basement on Saturday nights from 10:30 to 11pm... do you ever get... confused? Like, maybe the memory isn't quite right?
What do you mean, "not quite right?"
Like: does time ever seem like it's not moving normally? Like it's all out of whack?
I... I, uh--
Or do you ever have a hard time distinguishing between what happened in the show and what happened in real life? Like somehow the memories got jumbled around?
...Jumbled around?
Shook up in your head. Like a snow globe.
I'm trying to go slow. I don't want to alarm you.
You're not alarming me. I just... maybe we should talk to somebody about this. The police, or my dad, or--
No.
You can't tell anybody about this. Not like last time. You have to promise.
You have to promise.
Okay, Maddy. Jesus. I promise.
I came a very long way to see you. And to ask you this...
Will you just... will you tell me where you've been all these years?
That's what I've been trying to tell you.
I've been there.
Inside the show. Inside the Pink Opaque...
You see it too...
...He's getting closer.
I can't stay in this place much longer.
I'm going back there.
...Do you remember how it ended? The final episode?
I'll be at the high school tomorrow night at midnight. I hope you'll come.
It's time. We're ready.
Maddy...
That's not my name.
And I haven't told you anything tonight that you don't already know.
Tell me. Tell me you know it's true.
You told me yourself you felt it.
What he put inside us that night in the dining hall.
This...
This is insane.
I remember -- I remember playing in the snow. Driving to baseball games with my dad. Cooking with my mom.
Those memories were put there to distract you. To keep you trapped.
This isn't the Midnight Realm, Maddy. It's just the suburbs.
I told you. That's not my name.
And we need to go back down into the soil. Tonight.
You don't have much time.
I've got everything ready.
That spot behind the football field. Where the stoners used to get high after school.
No one will find us there.
Come on. She looks at him, and notices his terror.
I know it's scary. That's part of it. She keeps walking.
Tara...
